intro: Clypeola pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean clypeola, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh alpine conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Clypeola pyrenaica is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it plays a role in local biodiversity.
